data.title: General Manager and Mayor :: Employment :: Ballina Shire Council
data.text:
ABOUT US

Change your lifestyle and live and work in a vibrant community and great coastal environment.

Ballina Shire Council is situated on the Far North Coast of New South Wales, 20 minutes from Byron Bay and one hour from the Gold Coast. The shire is a popular tourism destination with pristine beaches, rainforest retreats and hinterland hideaways.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Position

We are seeking an energetic and highly organised executive assistant to provide high-level administrative support to Council’s General Manager and Mayor, ensuring efficient operation and seamless coordination of their daily activities. Examples of key responsibilities include managing schedules, arranging meetings, and supporting the timely actioning of tasks while meeting customer service requirements.

The ideal candidate will be highly organised, demonstrate strong attention to detail, and possess excellent communication and multitasking skills. You will act as a liaison between the General Manager and Mayor and internal/external stakeholders, representing Council with professionalism and confidentiality.

To be successful you will bring

Behaviour that positively demonstrates Council’s values of: creative, accessible, respect, energetic and safe.

Certificate in Business / Secretarial Studies or equivalent and/or demonstrated experience in provision of executive support at senior management level.

Demonstrated experience working in Local Government or similar environment.

Proven highly developed communication skills with a strong track record of handling confidential information with the utmost professionalism and discretion.

Proven meticulous approach to work and presentation with strong problem-solving, coordination, and research skills.

Demonstrated customer service skills with proficiency in responding to a diverse audience with diverse inquiries.

Demonstrated advanced level of Microsoft 365 skills with a with a minimum accurate typing speed of 70wpm.

The rewards

An annual salary range of $77,500 to $88,900 (plus 11.5% superannuation) dependent upon skills, experience and qualifications.

19 day month working arrangement. Council is currently trialling a range of flexible working options. Subject to operational requirements, full time office staff will have access to a nine day fortnight, with a thirty minute lunch break.

Fitness Passport membership options.

An inclusive culture where all our people are valued, EEO, diversity and differences are respected.

An absolute focus on our peoples’ safety and well being.

Learning and career development opportunities.

Generous Award workplace conditions.

Click here to view the Position Description and Information Package.

Applications close

11.30pm on Friday 9 August 2024

Specific enquiries

Caroline Klose | Director Corporate and Community | 02 6686 1296

How to apply

Please Note: Once you start your online application, you cannot save and return to it later. You must use your email address, and not one used previously by another person who has applied for a position with Council.

You may wish to prepare your responses in a Word document. You can then COPY and PASTE your answers from Word into the below fields.

Have your Resume document ready to go.

Fill out all questions below. Click "Next". You will then be prompted to attach your resume and other documents (if applicable). Click "Next".

Review your application to confirm everything is correct. Click "Confirm" to submit your application.
